Sentence: この国では外国人であることで得をすることがある。
Translation: There are benefits to being a foreigner in this country.
S1: もちろん時間通りであることで知られています。
T1: Of course, they are known for being on time.
S2: 自然淘汰は少しずつ慎重な過程であることで知られます。
T2: Natural selection is known to be a gradual and careful process.

Sentence: 努力次第で日本の小説が原文で読めるようになります。
Translation: Depending on your effort, you can be able to read Japanese novels in Japanese.
S1: 花火大会は天気次第で中止になる場合もあります。
T1: The fireworks display may be cancelled depending on the weather
S2: 短期案件は内容次第で可能です。
T2: Short term projects are possible depending on the content.

Sentence: 万事は彼の決心次第だ。
Translation: Everything depends on his decision.
S1: これから先は君の腕次第だ。
T1: Now everything depends entirely on your ability.
S2: 彼の成功は努力次第だ。
T2: His success depends on his efforts.

Meaning: against, contrast to, reverse, opposite, contrary to
Sentence: 風が我々の進行方向と逆に吹いている。
Translation: The wind is blowing against our direction of travel.
S1: 天気予報と逆に雨が降り続いている。
T1: Contrary to the weather forecast, it's been raining.
S2: 半導体の場合は温度が下がると逆に抵抗は増大する。
T2: In the case of semiconductors, resistance conversely increases as temperature decreases.

Meaning: against, contrast to, reverse, opposite, contrary to
Sentence: 彼は私と逆の見方をした。
Translation: He saw it the opposite way I did.
S1: もし成功したければこれと逆のことをすべきです。
T1: If you want to succeed you should do the opposite of this.
S2: マウント処理と逆の処理。
T2: A process opposite of the mount process.

Sentence: 以前と比 べて手紙を書く人の数が減ってきている。
Translation: The number of people writing letters is decreasing compared to the past.
S1: 翻訳を原文と比べてみよう。
T1: Let’s try to compare the translation with the source text.
S2: ほかの区間と比べて運転本数は少ない。
T2: The operation is less frequent compared with other sections.

Sentence: 最近はモデルや女優としても活躍する歌手が増えてきた。
Translation: Recently, more and more singers are also working as models and actresses.
S1: 京都は観光地として人気が高い。
T1: Kyoto is very popular as a tourist destination.
S2: それは大臣として言われたことですか。
T2: Are you saying that in your capacity as Cabinet minister?

Sentence: これは日本おアパートとしては大きい方です。
Translation: As for Japanese apartment, this one of the biggest ones.
S1: このステーキは日本のステーキとしては安いです。
T1: This steak is cheap for a Japanese steak!
S2: このホテルはホテルとしてはいちばんよい。
T2: This hotel is the best hotel.

Sentence: 野口さんは私と違って手先が器用だ。
Translation: Unlike me, Mr. Noguchi is skilled with his hands.
S1: 妹は我慢強い僕と違ってとてもせっかちだ。
T1: My sister is very hot headed unlike me who is patient.
S2: 東京と違って札幌は冬がとても寒い。
T2: Unlike Tokyo, Sapporo has very cold winters.

Sentence: 今と違い電話も大変な苦労。
Translation: Unlike today, telephones are also a great hardship.
S1: 裏側のフレイムスは前面と違いブルーで。
T1: Flames on the reverse side are blue, unlike the front.
S2: フレークと違いメッキならではの輝きです。
T2: Unlike flakes it is a unique shine of plating.

Sentence: コースがバラエティ豊かだったのも今までと違うところです。
Translation: The variety of courses was also different from what we have seen in the past.

Sentence: 従来のノックピンポンチと違った新しい設計です。
Translation: This new design is different from the conventional knock pin punch.

Meaning: at the (same) time, when, as , while, as well as, upon
Sentence: 彼女は結婚と同時に会社をやめた。
Translation: She quit the company upon her marriage.

Meaning: as well as, with, along with, at the same time, when
Sentence: 彼はその薬をコップ1杯の水とともに飲んだ。
Translation: He drank the drug along with a glass of water.
S1: リラクゼーションマッサージは入浴と共に予約可能です。
T1: Relaxation massages can be booked together with bathing.

Sentence: 文化劇場と並んで、ショッピングや食事を楽しむ場所があります。
Translation: Along with the cultural theater, there are places to shop and dine.

Sentence: インストールのたびに構成チェックを実行する。
Translation: Perform a configuration check on every installation.

T1: We make a video for every project.

T2: Reset the counter for each request.

Translation: Due to the long rains, construction has been delayed considerably recently.
S1: 大雪のため電車が遅れています。
T1: Trains are delayed due to heavy snow.
S2: 強い風のため飛行機の出発が遅れています。
T2: Due to strong winds, flight departures have been delayed.

Meaning: for the purpose of, in order to, because of, for the benefit, on behalf
Sentence: お年寄りのために使い方の説明をもっと大きい字で書いてください。
Translation: Please write the instructions for use in larger letters for the elderly.
S1: 西洋美術を勉強するためにイタリア語を習っています。
T1: I am learning Italian in order to study Western art.
S2: 明日の試験のために習った単語や漢字を復習しておきます。
T2: I'll review the vocabulary and kanji I learned for tomorrow's exam.

Meaning: for the purpose of, in order to, because of, for the benefit, on behalf
Sentence: 本屋の店頭には中高年の男性のための料理雑誌が目立つ。
Translation: Cooking magazines for middle-aged and older men are prominent in bookstores.
S1: これは日本語を勉強する人のための本です。
T1: This is a book for those studying Japanese.
S2: このボタンは注文するときに店員さんを呼ぶためのものです。
T2: This button is for calling the waiter when ordering.

Sentence: 整合性と認証の他にプライバシーを要求します。

Translation: Save existing events before maintenance activities.
S1: 旅行の前に切符を買っておきます。
T1: I'll buy a ticket before my trip.
S2: ご飯の前に手を洗いましょう。
T2: Wash your hands before you eat.

Sentence: そのデパートの前に書店がある。
Translation: There is a bookstore in front of that department store.

S2: 僕の目の前に彼が突然現れた。
T2: He just appeared out of nowhere in front of me.

Sentence: 体も丈夫だからまた来年挑戦してください。
Translation: Your body is strong, so please try again next year.
S1: 簡単な手術だから心配することはありません。
T1: It's a simple surgery, so there is nothing to worry about.
S2: 必修だから取らざるをえない。
T2: I have to take it because it's required.

Sentence: 大阪までの間のどこかで駅弁買って食べよう。
Translation: I'll buy an ekiben somewhere on the way to Osaka and eat it.
S1: 地下鉄の梅田と難波の間で事故があったようです。
T1: There's been an accident on the subway between Umeda and Namba.

Sentence: ステレオと本棚の間にテレビを置いた。
Translation: I put the TV between the stereo and the bookshelf.
S1: 古本を買ったらページの間に一万円札が挟まっていた。
T1: I bought an old book and found a 10,000 yen bill stuck between the pages.

Meaning: while, during, throughout, all throughout (in entire time)
Sentence: わたしは夏の間ずっと北海道にいました。
Translation: I was in Hokkaido all summer.
S1: 彼は会議の間ずっと居眠りをしていた。
T1: He'd dozed off throughout the meeting.
S2: 彼女が戻ってくるまでの間喫茶店で本を読むことにした。
T2: I decided to read a book in a coffee shop until she came back.

Sentence: 夏休みの間に引っ越ししたいです。
Translation: I would like to move during the summer vacation.
S1: ４時から５時までの間に一度電話をください。
T1: Call me once between 4:00 and 5:00.
S2: 夏休みの間に彼女が出来ました。
T2: I got a girlfriend during my summer vacation.

Meaning: should be, It is expected that
Sentence: 日本に住んでいるので日本が上手なはずだ。
Translation: I live in Japan, so I must be good at Japan.
S1: 今日は祝日だから銀行は休みのはずだ。
T1: Today is a holiday, so banks should be closed.
S2: 列車は６時到着のはずだった。
T2: The train was supposed to arrive at 6:00.

Meaning: at the time of, when, during
Sentence: ピーク時間以外のときに自動バックアップを実行。
Translation: Perform automatic backups during off-peak hours.
S1: 子どもの運動会のときビデオをとってもかまいませんか。
T1: May I take a video of my child's field day?
S2: 地震のときはすぐに火を消しなさい。
T2: In the event of an earthquake, put out the fire immediately.

Sentence: あれで歌手のつもりだ。
Translation: He thinks he's a singer.
S1: 何のつもりでそんなことを言うのだ。
T1: What do you mean by that?
S2: 不法侵入のつもりはありません。
T2: We don't mean to trespass.

Sentence: 説明から電話リレーのようだ。
Translation: Looks like a phone relay from the description.
S1: 君が一番乗りのようだ。
T1: Looks like you're first in line.
S2: あのいえは空き家のようだ。
T2: That house looks vacant.

Meaning: it is that, the fact is that, the explanation is that
Sentence: 今晩彼と食事をする予定だったんだ。
Translation: I was supposed to have dinner with him tonight.
S1: 去年のプレゼントだったんだ。
T1: It was a gift from last year.
S2: 猫アレルギーなんです。
T2: I am allergic to cats.

Sentence: 正直だったので彼を雇った。
Translation: I hired him because he was honest.
S1: 明日は試験なので今日は早く寝ます。
T1: I'm going to bed early today because I have an exam tomorrow.
S2: 危険なのでその機械に触ってはいけません。
T2: Do not touch that machine as it is dangerous.

Sentence: 彼女は病気なのに仕事をしています。
Translation: Even though she is sick, she is working.
S1: 今日は祝日なのに働かなければなりません。
T1: Even though today is holiday, I have to work.
S2: 彼女がきれいなのに彼氏がいません。
T2: Although she is very beautiful, she doesn't have a boyfriend.

Sentence: 独身のうちにたくさん遊んでおきたい。
Translation: I want to enjoy life as much as I can while I am still single.
S1: 今のうちに書いておこう。
T1: I'll write it down while I'm at it.

Meaning: because of, by means of, by (someone/something), based on, according to, depending on each case
Sentence: 大雪によって電車は３時間以上も遅れました。
Translation: Due to the heavy snow, the train was more than 3 hours late.
S1: 料金は荷物の重さや大きさによって変わります。
T1: Fees vary depending on the weight and size of the luggage.
S2: 文化は国によって異なります。
T2: Culture varies from country to country.

Meaning: because of, by means of, by (someone/something), based on, according to, depending on each case
Sentence: その事故は彼の車の運転における不注意によるものであった。
Translation: The accident was due to his careless driving of the car.
S1: 大雨による影響で電車が遅延した。
T1: Heavy rains caused train delays.
S2: 地震による津波の心配はありません。
T2: There is no concern about tsunamis caused by earthquakes.

Sentence: セキュリティによると誤警報でした。
Translation: According to security, it was a false alarm.
S1: 今朝の新聞によるとフィリピンで大きな地震があったそうです。
T1: According to this morning's newspaper, there was a major earthquake in the Philippines.
S2: 天気予報によると明後日には関東地方に大型の台風が上陸するそうです。
T2: According to the weather forecast, a large typhoon will hit the Kanto region the day after tomorrow.

Sentence: 朝食抜きで働くのは苦痛であった。
Translation: Working without breakfast was painful.
S1: 今後の飲み会は彼抜きでやりましょう。
T1: Let's do future drinking sessions without him.

Sentence: 冗談は抜きにして君は僕のタイプだよ。
Translation: Without kidding, you're my type.
S1: 堅い話は抜きにして気楽にやりましょう。
T1: Let's take it easy and skip the formalities.
S2: 冗談は抜きにしてそろそろ本題に入りましょうか。
T2: Joking aside, it is time to get down to business.

Meaning: after much, ended up, in the end, after all
Sentence: 毎日の残業のあげく彼女は倒れて入院することになりました。
Translation: After working overtime every day she collapsed and had to be hospitalized.
S1: 何回もの手術ものあげく結局病気は治りませんでした。
T1: After many surgeries, the disease could not be cured.

Meaning: comprised of, dispensable to, having with

Sentence: 彼らは地震のあとその町から逃げ出した。
Translation: They fled that town after the earthquake.
S1: タグのあとの変更だけをマージする。
T1: Merge only the changes after the tag.
S2: テイクオーバーの強制実行のあとデータを回復します。
T2: Recover data after forced takeover

Sentence: そして処刑のあとにテープを公表する。
Translation: And after the execution, they will release the tapes.
S1: パラメータ値のあとにある空白は無視されます。
T1: Whitespace after a parameter value is ignored.
S2: 映画の後に食事をします。
T2: Dinner will be served after the movie.

Sentence: ディナーのあとで私は海岸を散歩する。
Translation: After dinner I take a walk on the beach.
S1: 雨のあとで庭は水びたしだった。
T1: The garden was flooded after the rain.
S2: 卒業の儀式のあとでお祝いにしましょ。
T2: Let's celebrate after the graduation ceremony.
